Question
========

In a study of differences between nursing and care homes looked at, among other things, the age of the (502) residents in the sample. Age was divided into 5 classes for this purpose. The results are shown in the cross tabulation below:

  ----------------- ------- ------- ------- ------- ----- Frequency 50-64 65-74 75-84 85-94 â‰¥95 nursing home 4 27 96 108 14 nursing home 0 6 91 129 27 ----------------- ------- ------- ------- ------- -----

The probability that a randomly drawn person is younger than 85, given that he/she lives in a nursing home, is

Answerlist
----------

* 0.25
* 0.45
* 0.51
* 0.57

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.25: Incorrect
* 0.45: Incorrect
* 0.51: Correct
* 0.57: Incorrect
